text: Solomon Islands competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Solomon Islands entered two swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Edgar Iro |align=left|100 m freestyle |1:00.98 |113 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|50 m butterfly |29.40 |82 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Clayment Lafiara |align=left|50 m freestyle |27.39 |116 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|50 m breaststroke |34.37 |67 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Solomon Islands at the World Aquatics Championships Category:2019 in Solomon Islands sport
title: Solomon Islands at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
